body: I'm really confused now, why were we disabling stack smashing protection?

> I'm really confused now, why were we disabling stack smashing protection?

I don't think this code was actually doing anything. The `--enable-stack-protector` option (defaulting to off) was added to glibc in this [commit](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;f=configure.ac;h=03baef1c9cfb396d76cae20a00aee657871e79c4) (version 2.25) with the following [release note](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=blob_plain;f=NEWS;hb=HEAD):
> * Most of glibc can now be built with the stack smashing protector enabled.
  It is recommended to build glibc with --enable-stack-protector=strong.
  Implemented by Nick Alcock (Oracle).

As of the latest glibc release branch (2.35), it's still [defaulting to off](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=blame;f=configure.ac;hb=81e0662e5f2c342ffa413826b7b100d56677b613#l244).

If the default condition (compile glibc code with ssp) is off, us explicitly disabling it isn't changing any behaviour, which is why this code in our manifest is somewhat confusing. Note that any disabling would also haved only applied to the glibc used to build the RISCV binary ([2.27](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/34869114a72435b9d8364385abaefed70d703fa8/contrib/guix/manifest.scm#L543)), as the glibc we use for all other Linux hosts ([2.24](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/34869114a72435b9d8364385abaefed70d703fa8/contrib/guix/manifest.scm#L524)), is too old to have the `--enable-stack-protector` option.

What I want to do going forward, is start opting us into hardening options where available, when building our toolchains. i.e passing `--enable-stack-protector=strong/all` when building glibc.

The code being removed here was introduced in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22365.

Thanks. Yes, I agree, it doesn't make a difference then, it's disabled by default, by default. It was just strange to see it being disabled explicitly.
 
We explicitly set the option in our own build system so setting it at the toolchain level would at most affect other dependencies. Which could be good for libraries that interact with the network like miniupnp, libevent. 

In any case, concept ACK.

> We explicitly set the option in our own build system so setting it at the toolchain level would at most affect other dependencies. Which could be good for libraries that interact with the network like miniupnp, libevent.

It would also at least affect any compiled glibc / startup code that we pull in. As an example, building for RISC-V (because it uses glibc 2.27 which has the ssp option) and inspecting `atexit`.
master + this PR:
```bash
guix-build-34869114a724/distsrc-34869114a724-riscv64-linux-gnu/src/bitcoind:     file format elf64-littleriscv

00000000007aa078 <atexit>:
  7aa078:	003a5617          	auipc	a2,0x3a5
  7aa07c:	f8863603          	ld	a2,-120(a2) # b4f000 <__dso_handle>
  7aa080:	4581                	li	a1,0
  7aa082:	ff8b3317          	auipc	t1,0xff8b3
  7aa086:	41e30067          	jr	1054(t1) # 5d4a0 <__cxa_atexit@plt>
```

master + this PR + glibc ssp:
```bash
guix-build-3b307388963d/distsrc-3b307388963d-riscv64-linux-gnu/src/bitcoind:     file format elf64-littleriscv

00000000007aa078 <atexit>:
  7aa078:	003aa797          	auipc	a5,0x3aa
  7aa07c:	3c87b783          	ld	a5,968(a5) # b54440 <__stack_chk_guard@GLIBC_2.27>
  7aa080:	6398                	ld	a4,0(a5)
  7aa082:	1101                	addi	sp,sp,-32
  7aa084:	ec06                	sd	ra,24(sp)
  7aa086:	e43a                	sd	a4,8(sp)
  7aa088:	6722                	ld	a4,8(sp)
  7aa08a:	639c                	ld	a5,0(a5)
  7aa08c:	00f71d63          	bne	a4,a5,7aa0a6 <atexit+0x2e>
  7aa090:	60e2                	ld	ra,24(sp)
  7aa092:	003a5617          	auipc	a2,0x3a5
  7aa096:	f6e63603          	ld	a2,-146(a2) # b4f000 <__dso_handle>
  7aa09a:	4581                	li	a1,0
  7aa09c:	6105                	addi	sp,sp,32
  7aa09e:	ff8b3317          	auipc	t1,0xff8b3
  7aa0a2:	40230067          	jr	1026(t1) # 5d4a0 <__cxa_atexit@plt>
  7aa0a6:	ff8b3097          	auipc	ra,0xff8b3
  7aa0aa:	2ba080e7          	jalr	698(ra) # 5d360 <__stack_chk_fail@plt>
```

* [#25484](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25484) (Guix: enable toolchain hardening by default by fanquake)
